title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 April 2009 - XWiki
content:

sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 00:30): jvelociter\_: What's the license of the modalbox?  
jvelociter\_ - (24/04/2009 00:30): MIT I think  
jvelociter\_ - (24/04/2009 00:30): let me check  
jvelociter\_ - (24/04/2009 00:31): yes, MIT  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 00:31): Where is it written?  
jvelociter\_ - (24/04/2009 00:32): the license ?  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 00:32): Yes  
jvelociter\_ - (24/04/2009 00:32): right I can't see it on github  
jvelociter\_ - (24/04/2009 00:34): it's written here : http://code.google.com/p/modalbox/  
ldubost joined #xwiki at 00:36  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 00:41

jvelociter\_ - (24/04/2009 00:42): but I don't think there's any issue including it

glerouge - (24/04/2009 12:00): Hi ancutagheorghe  
alexmaru - (24/04/2009 12:00): she's gone ;)  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (24/04/2009 12:01): glerouge:hai  
glerouge - (24/04/2009 12:02): hi  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (24/04/2009 12:03): I have some doubts regarding the #startmessagebox() macro.   
glerouge - (24/04/2009 12:04): which ones?  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (24/04/2009 12:04): I want to know that #xwikimessageboxstart() macro and #startmessagebox() are both same  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (24/04/2009 12:04): I did a search in macros.vm searching #startmessagebox() macro  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (24/04/2009 12:05): but unable to find it there  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (24/04/2009 12:05): also in the whole workspace  
glerouge - (24/04/2009 12:05): you couldn't find "startmessagebox"  right ?  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (24/04/2009 12:06): ya.in the message.vm its using the #xwikimessageboxstart() macro  
glerouge - (24/04/2009 12:07): so it's probably my bad and #xwikimessageboxstart() is the right macro name  
glerouge - (24/04/2009 12:07): sorry about the imprecise issue description  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (24/04/2009 12:09): ok np. I was totally confused. Now its ok :)  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (24/04/2009 12:11): glerouge:As I realized all the message types(warnings, error, notice) go through message.vm   
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (24/04/2009 12:12): I want to know the some good understanding about this improvement.  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (24/04/2009 12:13): is there any screen I can refer how to show a standard error message  
glerouge - (24/04/2009 12:13): yes  
glerouge - (24/04/2009 12:14): go to any page that doesn't exist yet  
glerouge - (24/04/2009 12:14): xwiki/bin/view/Main/WhateverPageName  
glerouge - (24/04/2009 12:14): the message you'll see will be in a box  
glerouge - (24/04/2009 12:14): as on http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Improvements/BoxExample  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (24/04/2009 12:14): ya I got it  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (24/04/2009 12:15): So you want something like this haaa :)  
glerouge - (24/04/2009 12:16): exactly :)  
ChathuraPrabudd1 - (24/04/2009 12:17): ok great. Thanks glerouge :). Now its more clear  
glerouge - (24/04/2009 12:18): :)

npm joined #xwiki at 19:00  
KermitTheFragger left at 19:05 ("Leaving")  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:08): i need help w/ $xwiki.jsx.use() && $xwiki.ssx.use() -- the instructions say to add an object of c lass XWiki.JavaScriptExtension and another of class XWiki.StyleSheetExtension -- and i see numerous references to these classes and objects in existing Xwiki pages, e.g. /xwiki/bin/edit/Main/RecentChanges?editor=object ............. the problem is that I cannot find these class-objects anywhere on the system. Is there a XAR where they reside?   
npm - (24/04/2009 19:09): (see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SkinExtensionsTutorial for details)  
tmortagne left at 19:10 ("Ex-Chat")  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 19:11): npm: these classes are created by default by the ssx plugin  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 19:11): you probably don't have it defined in your xwiki.cfg  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:11): hm... doh!  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:11): thanks ... that sounds like the problem  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:13): FYI, I got http://trunk.simile-widgets.org/exhibit/examples/presidents/presidents.html FULLY working in Xwiki (to show myself that I could work w/ Simile exhibit)  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:14): now i'm trying to use some of the skinx stuff for the first time to straighten out the hack i had to do to get it working  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:15): (i'm planning on putting all 600+ NPR feeds into it and having it drive the display in http://nielsmayer.com/xwiki/bin/view/Timeline/NprTimeline  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:16): with the google-map geolocation thing replaced by the physical location of the radio station with the feed  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:16): )  
jvdrean left at 19:18 ()  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:21): FYI, my 1.8 has WEB-INF/lib/xwiki-plugin-skinx-1.6.jar -- will that work ok or should I upgrade to http://download.forge.objectweb.org/xwiki/xwiki-plugin-skinx-1.7.jar  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:25): http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Plugins/SkinExtensionsPluginDownloads "How to install" -- not helpful -- it just  points to http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise181 ?  
cypromis left at 19:27 ("Leaving")  
ldubost joined #xwiki at 19:39  
mflorea left at 19:40 ("Leaving")  
lucaa left #xwiki at 19:42  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 19:43  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 19:48): npm: you're doing great stuff.... It's a pity I don't have enough time to follow all you're doing :)  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:50): thanks... so as far as I can tell, i have all the needed skinx plugins added to xwiki.plugins is there a xwiki.skinx=1 setting that is needed to enable skin extensions in xe1.8  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:50): i thought they were enabled by default  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 19:52  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:52): ^^^vmassol  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 19:53): npm: there's no such thing AFAIK.  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 19:53): you don't see the classes in the object editor?  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:53): correct  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:54): but there are documents with objects containing those classes, when you expand the panel in the object editor, it shows nothing  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:54): basically it  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:54):  it's missing XWiki.JavaScriptExtension XWiki.StyleSheetExtension  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 19:56): npm: I see the class being created here: http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-plugins/trunk/skinx/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/plugin/skinx/AbstractDocumentSkinExtensionPlugin.java  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 19:56): in getExtensionClass()  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:57): so is there some special initialization to get skinx working in a pretty default xe 1.8 multiwiki setup  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 19:58): it's called init()  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 19:58): in the same class  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 19:58): and init() is called by the plugin manager when it loads the plugin  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 19:58): vmassol: I noticed and Ludovic noticed too that in certain conditions the classes are not created  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 19:58): I'll have to investigate that  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:58): oh  
npm - (24/04/2009 19:59): what conditions can i chage to get it working :-)  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:00): sdumitriu: so it means the plugin manager doesn't call init() under some conditions?  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:00): (or that init() fails for some reason)  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:00): vmassol: If it's inside Abstract\*Plugin, it won't be called  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:00): The plugin manager calls a method only for the classes that \*directly\* implements it  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:01): So inherited methods don't work  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:01): oh that looks like a bug  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:01): No, it's a feature :)  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:01): But I agree that virtualInit is a critical feature that should be called anyway  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:02): sdumitriu: so init() is never called since it's only in Abstract\*Plugin  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:02): Initially it was inside the plugin  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:02): But I guess it was moved during refactorings  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:03): do we provide the classes in the default XAR?  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:03): if not then we have a regression in 1.8.2 I guess  
npm - (24/04/2009 20:03): i'm running 1.8.0  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:03): vmassol: No  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:03): And it's a regression since a long tim  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:03): e  
npm - (24/04/2009 20:03): and it's happening in 1.8.0  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:03): Not in 1.8.2  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:04): so how come I have the classes in my default XE?  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:04): They are in the main wiki  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:04): But not in virtual ones  
npm - (24/04/2009 20:04): so this is a multiwiki issue?  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:05): Yes  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:05): init() is always called, even if it's inherited  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:05): virtualInit no  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:05): It has to be a direct method to be called  
npm - (24/04/2009 20:06): can i refer to classes in the main wiki if i create them by hand, e.g. by using /xwiki/bin/addobject/ directly  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:06): Yes, but you should import them from someplace else  
npm - (24/04/2009 20:07): or just xar them up from the main wiki and stick them on nielsmayer.com  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:07): I have them here: http://www.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Import?viewer=attachments  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:07): (I had this problem 2 days ago)  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:08): See the last 2 attachments  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:08): sdumitriu: ok I've looked at XWikiPluginManager and I understand the pb now  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:08): sdumitriu: a pity we have not fixed this in 1.8.2  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:09): it would have been easy to add virtualInit() in the various ssx plugins for ex (quick fix)  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:09): Yes  
npm - (24/04/2009 20:09): what about just rolling a 1.8 jar  for now?  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:10): npm: actually you can rebuild the ssx plugins too   
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:10): and add virtualinit() to them that'll work too  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:10): but we need to fix this asap on our side  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:10): s/our/in the code in svn/  
npm - (24/04/2009 20:11): i think i'm going to leave that fix to the pros.. i have enough problems w/ my stuff :-)  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:11): sdumitriu: is there any risk in calling virtualInit() all the time?  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:12): looks the right thing to do  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:12): vmassol: Found the guy who moved the implementations  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:12): It was me  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:13): :p  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:13): :)  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:13): rev. 15009  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:13): we should remove                     getPluginManager().virtualInit(context); in updateDatabase() and instead call virtaulInit in initPlugin() in XWikiPluginManager no?  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:13): No  
npm - (24/04/2009 20:13): thanks for the rapid help on this one.... i was beginning to go nutty trynig to figure out why those classes were missing even thought the data was there in other documents using SSX JSX  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:14): init is called when starting the wiki  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:14): virtualInit is called for each database  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:14): you want to call virtualinit only the frist time a given wiki is init?  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:15): We don't have all the databases during startup  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:15): Yes, isn't it like this?  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:15): in getXWiki() somewhere inside the if (xwiki.isVirtualMode()) {  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:15): yes  
tmortagne joined #xwiki at 20:17  
kaaloo left at 20:19 ("Leaving.")  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:20): sdumitriu: using       "initdone" maybe?  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:20): (to only init once)  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:20): I don't understand  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:21): sdumitriu: we need to call virtualInit() once for each wiki when it's asked right?  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:21): Yes  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:21): so one way is inside XWiki.getXWiki() to check for "initdone"  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:21): see if it's set to 1  
florinciu left at 20:22 ("ChatZilla 0.9.84 [Firefox 3.0.9/2009040821]")  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:22): and it not call virtualinit()  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:22): s/it/if/  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:22): But this is not needed  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:22): getXWiki is called only once  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:22): For each wiki  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:22): it's called at each request  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:22): but yes you're right  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:22): updateDatabase already calls virtualInit()  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:24): so we could simply change XWikiPluginManager  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:24): and have virtualInit() method call virtualInit() fro all plugins  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:24): without checking if it's a method declared in the plugin  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:24): I'm not sure why we're doing this btw  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:24): Hm, do we really call getXWiki for each request?  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:24): since that method is in the XWikiPluginInterface anywqy  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:24): That's a major overkill  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:24): yes in XWikiAction  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:25): it is   
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:25): I was suprrised looking at the code just now  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:25): I though it was a bit more intelligent, using a cache  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:25): but we do need to extract the info from teh url  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:25): info = name of wiki  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:26): Yes, but that's string manipulation, not database management  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:26): No wonder XWiki is so slow  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:26): is there a db mgmt somewhere?  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:26): yes for findWikiServer  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:27): and getServerWikiPage  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:27): ah no there's a cahce  
sdumitriu - (24/04/2009 20:27): Where?  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:28): in findWikiServer  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:28): there's of course still xwiki.getDocument(serverwikipage, context);  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:28): so if the the wiki is large and the doc cache is small this is indeed a penalty  
ldubost left at 20:29 ()  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:29): btw all the synchronize are also a perf hog  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:29): all threads waiting....  
vmassol - (24/04/2009 20:32): sdumitriu: got to go for dinner  
ChathuraPrabuddh left at 20:33 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out))  
vmassol left at 20:33 ()
